marytts.language.tib
Class ToneBuilder

java.lang.Object
  marytts.modules.InternalModule
      marytts.language.tib.ToneBuilder
All Implemented Interfaces:
MaryModule
public class ToneBuilder
extends InternalModule

The Tibetan tonebuilder Checks first whether the tone is defined in the lexicon If the tone is not defined in the lexicon the tone-rules (defined in toneRules.xml) are applied. Created on 03.09.2005

Author:
Anna Hunecke, Jens Apel

applyRules

public java.lang.String applyRules(org.w3c.dom.Element e,
                                   org.w3c.dom.Element syllable,
                                   org.w3c.dom.Element nextSyl,
                                   org.w3c.dom.Element prevSyl,
                                   int sylpos,
                                   int maxsyl)
Find the first rule that matches and apply it

Parameters:
e - the element that contains the rules
syllable - the syllable to be processed
sylpos - the position of the syllable in the word (0 to maxsyl)
maxsyl - the number of syllables in the word (starting with 0)
Returns:
the sampa string found in the rules

compareRuleContent

public boolean compareRuleContent(java.lang.String letter,
                                  java.lang.String attribute,
                                  java.lang.String nodeName)
compares whether letters and tones in the XML file match with the prespecified letters and tones

Parameters:
letter - letters or tones
attribute - attribute where the letter or tone belongs too
nodeName - tagName of the attributes (attribute, action)
Returns:
true if the letter or tone exists

comparePossibleContent

public boolean comparePossibleContent(java.lang.String letter,
                                      java.lang.String attribute,
                                      java.lang.String nodeName)
compares whether letters and tones in the XML file match with the letters and tones that could possibly occur in the certain slots in tibetan

Parameters:
letter - or tones
attribute - attribute where the letter or tone belongs too
nodeName - tagName of the attributes (attribute, action)
Returns:
true if the letter or tone matches

checkAttributes

public void checkAttributes(java.lang.String tag,
                            java.lang.String attr,
                            java.lang.String num)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
checks the correctness of the tags and attributes of the rule file. In case a missmatch was found, an error massage is generated.

Parameters:
tag - tags of the rule file (e.g. action, attribute)
attr - attributes of the rule file (e.g. slot4, root)
num - number of the checked rule
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

                  throws java.lang.Exception

Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if there are problems reading the file

Look up a token in the lexicon

Parameters:
text - the text of the token
Returns:
a string array of the entry, or null, if text is not in lexicon
